page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The grid we have been studying, is situated in Fife Region. It is a mainly rural area, but contains four small villages along the coast of the {River Forth. }There are three farms _ Bullions, Bankhead, and Drumfin _ mainly{arable farms with a few {cattle. }The only fresh water is Loch Roy, situated to the north of Newmills. The largest village is{High {Valleyfield}in the north west corner } of the grid.It boasts a Community Centre and a Health Centre, which serve the surrounding villages.It is a predominately mining village, but now that Valleyfield Colliery has closed down,{unemployment}is high.Many miners work in other pits and during the Miner's Strike of 1984/85 feelings ran high.
